issue.title: [Dev] Set JIRA ticket's status to in progress once a pull request available
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-8085](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-8085). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
It's hard to see which tickets are in progress. Github actions build can be triggered on pull request creation and edit where we can parse out the Jira ticket. Call to the jira API to update the ticket's state (possibly update the components field as well.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-8085?focusedCommentId=17058075) by Neal Richardson (npr):*
+1000. Maybe this is crazy, but is this something we could do via INFRA? They have some bot/service that adds the pull-request-available label, so could we add the code there?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-8085?focusedCommentId=17058093) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
A problem with the "Start Progress" transition is that it requires an assignee, so I'm not sure this would work (the assignee would get set to the LDAP user who issued the API token)
